de.mrapp.android.dialog

Class AbstractButtonBarDialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.app.Dialog
      • de.mrapp.android.dialog.AbstractMaterialDialog
        • de.mrapp.android.dialog.AbstractHeaderDialog
          • de.mrapp.android.dialog.AbstractValidateableDialog
            • de.mrapp.android.dialog.AbstractButtonBarDialog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.DialogInterface, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, android.view.Window.Callback, ButtonBarDialog, ButtonBarDialogDecorator, Dialog, HeaderDialog, HeaderDialogDecorator, MaterialDialog, MaterialDialogDecorator, ValidateableDialog, ValidateableDialogDecorator
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractListDialog, ProgressDialog

    public abstract class AbstractButtonBarDialog
extends AbstractValidateableDialog
implements ButtonBarDialog
    An abstract base class for all dialogs, which are designed according to Android 5's Material design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and may contain up to three buttons.
    Since:
    3.2.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface android.content.DialogInterface

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractButtonBarDialog

        protected AbstractButtonBarDialog(android.content.Context context,
                                  int themeResourceId)
        Creates a dialog, which is designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and may contain up to three buttons.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the dialog, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        themeResourceId - The resource id of the theme, which should be used by the dialog, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid theme

    • Method Detail

      • getButton

        public final android.widget.Button getButton(int whichButton)
        Description copied from interface: ButtonBarDialogDecorator
        Returns one of the buttons, which is shown by the dialog.
        Specified by:
        getButton in interface ButtonBarDialogDecorator
        Parameters:
        whichButton - The identifier of the button, which should be returned, as an Integer value. The identifier must either be DialogInterface.BUTTON_POSITIVE, DialogInterface.BUTTON_NEGATIVE or DialogInterface.BUTTON_NEUTRAL
        Returns:
        The button, which corresponds to the given identifier, as an instance of the class Button or null, if the button is not shown or if the dialog has not been shown yet

      • setPositiveButton

        public final void setPositiveButton(java.lang.CharSequence text,
                                    android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener listener)
        Description copied from interface: ButtonBarDialogDecorator
        Sets the text of the positive button of the dialog.
        Specified by:
        setPositiveButton in interface ButtonBarDialogDecorator
        Parameters:
        text - The text, which should be set, as an instance of the type CharSequence or null, if no positive button should be shown
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when the positive button is clicked, as an instance of the type DialogInterface.OnClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified

      • onAttachDecorators

        protected void onAttachDecorators(android.view.View view)
        Description copied from class: AbstractMaterialDialog
        The method, which is invoked when the dialog's decorators should be attached. This method may be overridden by subclasses in order to attach additional decorators.
        Overrides:
        onAttachDecorators in class AbstractHeaderDialog
        Parameters:
        view - The root view of the view hierarchy, which should be modified by the decorators, as an instance of the class View. The view may not be null

      • onDetachDecorators

        public void onDetachDecorators()
        Description copied from class: AbstractMaterialDialog
        The method, which is invoked when the dialog's decorators should be detached. This method must be overridden by subclasses if they attach additional decorators.
        Overrides:
        onDetachDecorators in class AbstractHeaderDialog
